sentences.en: At a stroke, we would know who was profligate with company money and who was parsimonious.
sentences.cn: 这样我们一下子就能知道谁在恣意挥霍公司钱财,而谁节俭吝啬.

sentences.en: But like all the most successful illicit traders, China is ideologically profligate in its relations.
sentences.cn: 就像那些成功的违法交易以一样, 中国正在享受这种关系带来的好处.

sentences.en: German public opinion is firmly set against the public purse to help the profligate Greeks.
sentences.cn: 德国舆论坚决反对使用其国库的钱来帮助挥霍的希腊人.
他是个粗枝大叶的浪荡子.

sentences.en: It is not: the frugal depend on the profligate.
sentences.cn: 但事实并非如此: 节俭者要依靠挥霍者.

sentences.en: Lydia is a girl who follows exotic things, handsome man and is somehow a little profligate.
sentences.cn: 莉是个女孩,英俊的男人跟异国情调, 不知何故,有点挥霍无度.

sentences.en: the profligate use of energy resources
The young profligate needs to be controlled.
Their profligate lifestyle resulted in bankruptcy.
sentences.cn: 他们挥霍的生活方式导致的破产.

sentences.en: This young man had all the inclination to be a profligate of the first water.
sentences.cn: 这个青年完全有可能成为十足的浪子.

sentences.en: Thus the crisis punishes the frugal more than the profligate.
sentences.cn: 如此看来,危机对节俭者的惩罚,要比对恣意挥霍者更为严厉.

sentences.en: Why do you bring your profligate companions here?
sentences.cn: 为什么你要把你那些酒肉朋友带到这里来 呢 ?

sentences.en: Yet they have something in common: both involve the profligate deployment of resources.
sentences.cn: 然而这些行为却有着一些共同之处: 它们都牵涉了大肆的资源挥霍.

words.tran_cn: 放荡的，不检点的；恣意挥霍的

trans.tran_cn: 挥霍的，浪费的，放荡的，行为不检点的
trans.tran_en: wasting money or other things in a careless way
